xxl.core.cursors.visual
Interface Controllable

All Known Implementing Classes:
IteratorControllable
public interface Controllable

This interface defines a set of opeations that should be implemented by an object, to enhance this object by the possibility to be controlled remotely.

Method Summary
 void close()
          Closes the controllable object and releases ressources collected during its life cycle (optional operation).
 void go()
          Starts or resumes the life cycle of a controllable object.
 void go(int steps)
          Lets a controllable object perfom a given number of steps of its life cycle (optional operation).
 void init()
          Initializes a controllable object and prepares for the start of its life cycle.
 void pause()
          Pauses the life cycle of a controllable object.
 void reset()
          Resets the controllable object to the beginning of its life cycle (optional operation).
 boolean supportsClose()
          Indicates whether the controllable object supports the close() operation or not.
 boolean supportsGoSteps()
          Indicates whether the controllable object supports the go(int) operation or not.
 boolean supportsReset()
          Indicates whether the controllable object supports the reset() operation or not.
 

Method Detail

init

void init()
Initializes a controllable object and prepares for the start of its life cycle.

go

void go()
Starts or resumes the life cycle of a controllable object.

pause

void pause()
Pauses the life cycle of a controllable object.

go

void go(int steps)
        throws UnsupportedOperationException
Lets a controllable object perfom a given number of steps of its life cycle (optional operation).

Parameters:
steps - the number of steps the controllable object will be allowed to resume its life cycle.
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - if the go(int) operation is not supported by the controllable object.

supportsGoSteps

boolean supportsGoSteps()
Indicates whether the controllable object supports the go(int) operation or not.

Returns:
true if the controllable object supports the go(int) operation, otherwise false.

reset

void reset()
           throws UnsupportedOperationException
Resets the controllable object to the beginning of its life cycle (optional operation).

Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - if the reset() operation is not supported by the controllable object.

supportsReset

boolean supportsReset()
Indicates whether the controllable object supports the reset() operation or not.

Returns:
true if the controllable object supports the reset() operation, otherwise false.

close

void close()
           throws UnsupportedOperationException
Closes the controllable object and releases ressources collected during its life cycle (optional operation).

Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - if the close() operation is not supported by the controllable object.

supportsClose

boolean supportsClose()
Indicates whether the controllable object supports the close() operation or not.

Returns:
true if the controllable object supports the close() operation, otherwise false.
